On the other hand, the U.S. economy depends heavily on this very same undocumented labor to sustain key sectors such as agriculture, domestic services, and low-skilled maintenance jobs, where local labor would be prohibitively expensive due to near full employment conditions.
Rather than legalizing and protecting this essential workforce, the author argues that successive governments have deliberately chosen to 'look the other way.' This approach benefits employers by maintaining a large pool of workers in a state of permanent vulnerability, which keeps wages low and labor compliant. Social discomfort with visibl

item.title: High Debt Levels of Major Tech Companies Could Threaten Financial Stability
item.description: Tech giants in Silicon Valley, including Alphabet, Amazon, Meta, Microsoft, and Oracle, are undergoing a significant financial transformation. Once flush with cash, these companies are now borrowing massive amounts to fund artificial intelligence initiatives, building large-scale data centers, and purchasing costly electronic chips. The transition from agile software firms to heavy infrastructure-dependent corporations has made them increasingly reliant on lenders. Analysts warn that by 2030, half of the ten largest debtors in the U.S. could be these tech companies investing in vast server facilities. Financial institutions are observing growing concern as the gap between the companies’ debt and their returns widens. Morgan Stanley projects that tech firms will raise $400 billion in debt this year, up from $170 billion last year and $44 billion in 2024. In the U.S., around 14.5% of credit is currently allocated to data center construction, a figure expected to reach nearly 20% by 2030,

item.title: Unsealed 2023 Voice Memo from Blake Lively to Justin Baldoni Reveals Postpartum Struggles and Filming Schedule Concerns Amid Ongoing Lawsuit
item.description: A four-minute voice memo sent by Blake Lively to Justin Baldoni on February 8, 2023, has been unsealed and made public as part of their continuing legal dispute, which stems from Lively's December 2024 lawsuit alleging sexual harassment and retaliation—claims Baldoni has denied. In the candid recording, sent weeks before principal photography began on the film It Ends With Us, Lively addresses Baldoni warmly but with caution, emphasizing that the message is premature and meant to stay private. She confides in him as a trusted colleague and friend, mentioning her recent conversation with husband Ryan Reynolds, who encouraged her to share openly due to their good rapport. Lively describes feeling overwhelmed returning to work shortly after giving birth to her fourth child, lacking a baby nurse, dealing with sleep deprivation, and facing pressure to regain physical shape while preparing for the role. She expresses panic over the tight March/April filming start date, suggesting a potential

item.title: A Practical Guide to Maintaining Oral Health from Infancy to Senior Years
item.description:
The article provides a comprehensive overview of oral health practices tailored to every stage of life, emphasizing that good dental care is essential not only for a healthy smile but also for overall well-being. It begins with infants and toddlers, explaining that oral care should start even before teeth emerge by gently cleaning gums. Once the first tooth appears, parents are encouraged to use a soft toothbrush with a small amount of fluoride toothpaste and to schedule a child’s first dental visit by age one to establish positive habits early.
For children aged three to twelve, the guide stresses the importance of supervised brushing, proper flossing techniques, and regular dental checkups every six months. Preventive treatments such as fluoride applications and dental sealants are highlighted, along with the role of good nutrition and limiting sugary foods and drinks. During the teenage years, the focus shifts to challenges such as braces, wisdom teeth, and lifestyle habits that ca

item.title: How Capital One Cardholders Can Convert Cash Back Rewards Into Transferable Miles
item.description:
The article explains an often-overlooked feature of Capital One credit cards: the ability for cardholders to convert cash back rewards into Capital One miles by moving rewards between eligible accounts. This option can significantly increase the value of everyday spending and welcome bonuses, especially for users who want to earn airline or hotel miles instead of simple cash back.
Capital One allows transfers between a cardholder’s own accounts, meaning cash back earned on cards like the Savor, SavorOne, or Spark Cash can be converted at a rate of $0.01 per dollar to one mile when moved to Venture, Venture X, or VentureOne cards. Since these miles can then be transferred to airline and hotel partners at consistent ratios, cardholders can effectively earn higher mileage rates in categories such as dining, groceries, and entertainment—sometimes without paying an annual fee.
The article highlights why this flexibility matters. Capital One has relatively few bonus categories on its miles

item.title: Rove launches limited-time bonuses for first hotel bookings and boosted shopping rewards
item.description:
Rove Miles has introduced a set of short-term promotions designed to increase engagement with its hotel booking platform and shopping portal, running through February 1, 2026. The headline offer targets new users booking hotels through Rove for the first time. Eligible customers can earn 2,500 bonus Rove Miles after spending $500, or 5,000 bonus miles after spending $1,000 or more on a single hotel booking. These bonuses require the use of specific promo codes and are limited to one code per customer. Importantly, taxes and fees count toward the spending thresholds, and the hotel booked does not need to be loyalty-eligible.
In addition to the first-time booking bonuses, Rove is offering increased earning rates through its shopping portal, particularly for gift card purchases made via Giftcards.com. After clicking through the Rove portal, customers can earn elevated miles on a wide range of brands. Earning rates vary by retailer, with some of the highest returns including 10x miles on

item.title: Wingtip Camera Captures Ukrainian Su-25 Destroyed by Suspected Russian R-37M Missile, Killing Experienced Pilot
item.description: A dramatic video recorded by a camera mounted on the wingtip of a Ukrainian Air Force Su-25 Frogfoot close air support jet shows the aircraft being struck and rapidly disintegrating after reportedly being hit by a long-range Russian air-to-air missile, likely an R-37M (AA-13 Axehead). The footage, which surfaced publicly in late January 2026, captures the moment of impact with a flash and sparks, followed by the canopy partially tearing away, an external fuel tank detaching, and the plane cartwheeling out of control as the fuselage rips open and burns. The sequence ends with the wing spiraling to the ground amid thick black smoke, all within less than 20 seconds, leaving virtually no time for the pilot to eject using the Zvezda K-36 seat despite catastrophic damage. The aircraft, tactical number '21 Blue', was piloted by Stanislav Rykov of the 299th Tactical Aviation Brigade, an experienced pilot with 385 combat sorties, who was killed on February 7, 2024, during a mission near Novotro

item.title: A Decade Inside Podemos: From Grassroots Activism to Political Disillusionment
item.description: Podemos, the Spanish left-wing party that emerged from the 2011 anti-austerity 15-M protests, experienced a rapid rise and a gradual decline over a decade. Founded by Pablo Iglesias in 2014, the party quickly gained traction, winning seats in the European Parliament and disrupting Spain's entrenched two-party system. The author, Lilith Verstrynge, joined Podemos early as an adviser to its MEPs and later worked in the Spanish government under Iglesias. Initially motivated by idealism and a desire to enact tangible policy change, she witnessed both the excitement of grassroots mobilization and the challenges of governance. Podemos' strategy relied heavily on media presence and populist messaging, which helped achieve rapid political success but limited the party's long-term organizational capacity. Internal divisions, leadership changes, and the rise of the Sumar coalition contributed to Podemos’ diminishing influence. While the party achieved significant legislative milestones, includin

item.title: The Jumpseat SIGINT Satellites: Newly Declassified Details of a Cold War Espionage Program
item.description:
Between 1971 and 1987, at the height of the Cold War, the United States launched a series of highly classified reconnaissance satellites known by the codename JUMPSEAT. Unlike photographic or radar-imaging spy satellites, Jumpseat spacecraft were dedicated to signals intelligence (SIGINT), intercepting Soviet radar emissions and microwave communications. For decades, almost all technical details about these satellites remained secret, until the National Reconnaissance Office (NRO) recently declassified images and partial specifications of the program.
The Jumpseat satellites weighed around 700 kilograms and were placed in highly elliptical Molniya orbits, optimized to linger over the Northern Hemisphere. This orbital configuration allowed them to monitor Soviet early-warning radar systems and communication links for extended periods. Built by Hughes, their design was based on the HS-308/318 satellite platforms, featuring a rotating cylindrical bus covered in solar panels, while the pa

item.title: Former Trump Supporters Describe Loss of Trust After Deadly Federal Shootings
item.description:
The article describes an alleged wave of political reassessment among former supporters of Donald Trump following two fatal shootings by federal agents that reportedly occurred earlier in the month. According to the piece, the deaths of Renee Good and Alex Pretti became a catalyst for widespread online discussion, particularly on Reddit, where thousands of users claimed they had once supported Trump but now felt compelled to reconsider their views.
Many of the responses highlighted in the article focus on fear and disillusionment rather than a sudden shift toward liberal politics. Self-identified conservatives, moderates, veterans, and lifelong Republicans are quoted as saying that recent events forced them to confront concerns about government power, civil liberties, and constitutional norms. Several commenters reportedly expressed alarm at what they perceived as an expanded and intimidating role for federal agencies, especially Immigration and Customs Enforcement, which they said ma

item.title: ICE Detains Father, Denying Request to Attend Son's Funeral Despite Caregiver Role
item.description: Maher Tarabishi, a 62-year-old man detained by U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) in Dallas on October 28, 2025, has been denied a humanitarian release to attend his son Wael Tarabishi's funeral. Wael, 30, suffered from Pompe disease, a rare genetic condition causing severe muscle weakness, and died on January 23, 2026, after months of hospitalization and complications. Maher had been Wael’s primary caretaker for years, providing round-the-clock support due to his son’s critical medical needs. His attorney, Ali Elhorr, and family members emphasized that Maher had consistently complied with annual ICE check-ins and had never committed any crimes. Despite this, ICE cited alleged ties to the Palestine Liberation Organization, which Maher's family denies. Wael’s death has been deeply affected by the absence of his father, with his daughter-in-law stating that Maher was his “father, best friend, and caregiver.” The family has organized a GoFundMe to support Maher’s legal defense

item.title: New United Quest Card Offer Combines Mileage Bonus and Premier Qualifying Points
item.description:
The article reports on a newly released welcome offer for the United Quest℠ Card, a co-branded Chase credit card aimed at frequent United Airlines travelers. The updated promotion provides cardholders with 80,000 United MileagePlus miles and 3,000 Premier Qualifying Points (PQPs) after spending $4,000 within the first three months of account opening. An additional 10,000 miles can be earned by adding an authorized user during the same initial period. The card carries a $350 annual fee and is subject to Chase’s 5/24 approval rule.
A key highlight of this offer is the inclusion of PQPs, which count toward United elite status. The 3,000 PQPs from the welcome bonus alone bring applicants halfway to Premier Silver status, making the offer particularly attractive for travelers pursuing United elite benefits. The article also notes that while a higher bonus of 100,000 miles and 3,000 PQPs was previously available, that offer expired in August 2025.
Beyond the sign-up bonus, the United Quest

item.title: Chase United Business Cards Offer 100,000 Bonus Miles Plus 2,000 PQP After $5,000 Spend
item.description: This article from Frequent Miler, published July 17, 2025, announces elevated welcome bonuses for two Chase-United co-branded business credit cards. The United℠ Business Card ($150 annual fee) provides 100,000 United MileagePlus miles and 2,000 Premier Qualifying Points (PQP) after $5,000 spend in 3 months, with an extra 10,000 miles for adding an authorized user (up to 110,000 total possible). The United Club℠ Business Card ($695 annual fee) matches the 100,000 miles + 2,000 PQP, plus 10,000 authorized user miles for 110,000 total, and includes United Club lounge membership. Both cards feature strong perks like enhanced award availability, complimentary elite upgrades on awards, free checked bags, priority boarding, no foreign fees, annual credits (travel, rideshare, hotels), DashPass, Instacart benefits, and PQP earning through spend. The low spend threshold makes these among the most valuable business card offers, especially for United loyalists, with estimated first-year value over

item.title: Global Firepower 2026: Russia Leads European Military Ranking
item.description: According to the Global Firepower 2026 report, Russia is currently the strongest military power in Europe. Despite significant losses during the war in Ukraine, Russia maintains structural advantages in conventional military strength due to its large army, extensive tank and artillery fleet, and substantial air and naval capabilities. France ranks second in Europe and first within the European Union, supported by a versatile military able to operate across land, sea, and air, as well as its global deployment experience. The United Kingdom, in third place, remains a key military player in Europe despite leaving the EU, with advanced technology, modern aircraft carriers, and strong air capabilities, enhanced by close NATO integration and strategic alliances with the United States. Beyond the top three, European military power shows a mix of disparities and growth dynamics, with countries like Italy, Germany, Spain, and Poland investing in rearmament programs. The article highlights the m

item.title: Erika Kirk Faces Backlash Over Remarks on Turning Point USA Donations and Sales After Husband’s Memorial
item.description:
The article reports on renewed controversy surrounding Erika Kirk, CEO of Turning Point USA and widow of the organization’s founder, Charlie Kirk, after conservative commentator Candace Owens released leaked audio of an internal staff meeting held 11 days after Charlie’s death. In the audio, posted on TikTok, Erika appears to praise the team for staging what she calls an “event of the century” in reference to her husband’s memorial, emphasizing that more than 275,000 people attended and highlighting the volume of donors, voter registrations, and merchandise sales tied to the event. She mentions thousands of new voter registrations, merchandise sales she believes exceed 200,000 dollars, and notes that staff worked 20‑hour days without sleep leading up to the memorial.
Erika also urges staff to put aside any internal conflicts, saying that her husband’s death has underscored how short life is and how relationships matter, framing the moment as one in which God places people in each othe

item.title: Hawaiian Airlines Bank of Hawaii Mastercard Returns with 60,000 Atmos Points Welcome Bonus
item.description: The Hawaiian Airlines® Bank of Hawaii World Elite Mastercard®, issued by Barclays, has reappeared after a period of unavailability. It now features a welcome offer of 60,000 Atmos Points (the rewards currency following the Alaska Airlines and Hawaiian Airlines merger into Atmos Rewards) after spending $2,000 within the first 90 days. The card carries a $99 annual fee. Earning rates include 3x points on purchases with Alaska Airlines and Hawaiian Airlines, 2x on gas, dining, and grocery stores, and 1x on all other purchases. Key perks include two free checked bags on Alaska or Hawaiian flights when booked through those airlines, a one-time 50% off companion ticket for roundtrip coach travel between Hawaii and North America on Hawaiian or Alaska routes, $100 off a companion ticket annually at each account anniversary for similar routes, and a $100 annual statement credit toward inflight purchases (up to $10 per day) for eligible Atmos status members on Hawaiian and Alaska flights. The ar

item.title: IHG launches targeted challenge to earn Diamond status with 8 paid nights by March 2026
item.description:
IHG One Rewards has introduced a new targeted status challenge that allows select members to earn its top-tier Diamond Elite status by completing just eight paid nights within a limited time frame. This promotion is aimed at members who receive a direct invitation from IHG and requires advance registration before any qualifying stays are booked. The promotion period runs from January 22, 2026, through March 8, 2026, and only nights stayed during this window count toward the challenge.
To qualify, members must complete eight paid nights at participating IHG Hotels & Resorts, excluding certain Six Senses and Iberostar Beachfront Resorts that do not participate in the loyalty program. Each night must be booked at a qualifying cash rate costing more than $30 per night (or local equivalent). Reward nights and Points & Cash bookings are explicitly excluded, meaning only fully paid stays are eligible. Additionally, stays completed before registration or outside the promotion period do not co

item.title: Barron Trump’s Call Helps Secure Conviction in London Assault Case
item.description: A London court case gained international attention after Barron Trump, 19-year-old son of the U.S. president, alerted authorities to an assault while speaking with the victim via FaceTime. On January 18, 2025, Matvei Rumiantsev, a 22-year-old former MMA fighter from a wealthy Russian family, allegedly assaulted his girlfriend in her Canary Wharf apartment. During the call, Barron witnessed part of the attack and immediately contacted UK emergency services. Prosecutors stated that Rumiantsev’s actions were fueled by jealousy over the woman’s friendship with Barron. The assault reportedly involved physical violence, verbal abuse, and threats. Rumiantsev was found guilty of assault occasioning actual bodily harm and perverting the course of justice, the latter related to a letter sent from prison attempting to retract the victim’s complaint. He was acquitted of other charges, including rape and intentional strangulation, and will be sentenced on March 27, 2026. Despite his privileged back

item.title: Xi Jinping Initiates Major Political-Military Restructuring in Chinese Army
item.description: Over the past weekend, Chinese military forces were deployed in Beijing following what is described as the largest political purge in the history of the People's Liberation Army (PLA). The Ministry of Defense announced investigations into two generals from the Central Military Commission and the General Staff, including Zhang Youxia, for alleged 'illegal activities.' The Central Military Commission, led by Xi Jinping, controls not only the army but also police and militia forces. Since Xi Jinping assumed leadership of the Communist Party in 2012, more than 200,000 military personnel, including over 110 generals, have been removed or disciplined. The current purge targets missile artillery units, the defense industry, and operational command departments. Analysts note this is not a standard corruption case or bureaucratic reorganization, but a large-scale political restructuring initiated in 2023 aimed at preventing leaks of sensitive military information to Taiwan and the United States

item.title: Kristi Noem Attributes Her Actions to Guidance from Trump and Stephen Miller Amid Controversial Minneapolis Shootings
item.description: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem has stated that her decisions and actions in office have been directed by former President Donald Trump and his advisor, Stephen Miller. This statement comes amid controversy over the deaths of Alex Pretti and Renee Good, who were killed by federal agents in Minneapolis. Administration officials, including Noem and Miller, claimed Pretti intended to attack agents, labeling him an 'assassin.' However, video evidence has cast doubt on these claims, leading to confusion within the White House regarding the official statements released about the incident. Some officials reportedly tried to revise the Department of Homeland Security's statements before dissemination, but the statements had already been published. White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt defended Miller as one of Trump’s closest and most trusted aides. The city of Minneapolis is suing the administration over the deployment of ICE, highlighting ongoing tension over federal enforceme

item.title: Teddi Mellencamp Opens Up About Starting Therapy to Cope with Emotional and Physical Effects of Cancer Recovery
item.description: Teddi Mellencamp, the 44-year-old former Real Housewives of Beverly Hills star, recently shared a candid health and emotional update on her podcast, Two T’s in a Pod. She revealed that she has begun therapy to address the psychological impact of her cancer journey, noting that it has been emotionally taxing. Mellencamp described physical frustrations, including feeling slower than before, difficulty with touch and movement, and a strong desire to return to her pre-diagnosis state. Her battle began with a melanoma diagnosis that progressed to stage 4, with tumors found in her brain and lungs earlier in 2025, leading to emergency surgery, immunotherapy, and other treatments. She explained that the combination of medications, physical side effects, her divorce, emergency surgery, and separation from her children during recovery has only recently started to fully register emotionally. In October 2025, she announced that scans showed no detectable cancer, marking a significant milestone, th

item.title: Joe Doucet and Oublier Create Furniture Designed for Centuries of Use
item.description: Joe Doucet, in collaboration with Bulgarian design studio Oublier, has introduced 'Columns,' a furniture piece designed with longevity and sustainability in mind. Unlike typical furniture that often prioritizes trends or novelty, Columns emphasizes durability, crafted from solid oak, natural leather, and horsehair—materials chosen for their ability to age gracefully and acquire character over time. The design challenges conventional ideas of sustainability, which often focus on recycling or disposable alternatives, by proposing an approach rooted in endurance. Columns is a minimalist bench that encourages reflection on the lifespan of objects in a culture obsessed with the new and temporary. By prioritizing craftsmanship and timeless materials, the piece invites users to consider sustainability not as a checklist of eco-friendly claims but as the creation of objects that can last lifetimes. This project exemplifies a conceptual shift in design, emphasizing resilience, quality, and thou

item.title: Trump Comments on the Deaths of Alex Pretti and Renee Good Amid Minneapolis ICE Operations
item.description: Former President Donald Trump expressed his condolences over the deaths of Renee Nicole Good and Alex Pretti in Minneapolis during a Fox News interview. Good, a 37-year-old mother of three, was fatally shot by a masked ICE agent, Jonathan Ross, during a federal immigration enforcement operation. Pretti, a 37-year-old ICU nurse, was killed by immigration agents while filming officers at a protest. Trump stated that he felt particularly bad about Good’s death because her parents were strong supporters of him, describing them as 'tremendous Trump people.' He suggested that Good may have been 'radicalized' despite her family's political leanings. The Trump administration initially framed both victims as threats, with officials labeling Pretti as a would-be domestic terrorist and claiming Good attempted to harm agents with her vehicle. Following public backlash, the narrative around Pretti shifted to focus on his possession of a firearm. In response to the incidents, Trump sent Border Czar

item.title: Guide to Locating Online Benefit Guides for Major Credit Card Issuers
item.description: When you receive a new credit card, it typically includes a physical 'Guide to Benefits' booklet that outlines purchase protections, travel insurance, and other safeguards like ID theft protection or concierge services in fine print. However, these booklets exclude many other perks such as rewards earning rates, annual free nights, companion certificates, or fee waivers. To access these guides digitally for easier reference—especially for purchase and travel protections—several major issuers provide them online. American Express offers separate documents for each benefit without requiring login at americanexpress.com/us/credit-cards/features-benefits/policies, where users select a benefit and then view the guide for their specific card. Capital One simplifies access via capitalone.com/credit-cards/benefits-guide, listing guides by card, with extra Mastercard details available through priceless.com. For Chase cardholders, entering the card number at chasecardbenefits.com/guide-to-benefi

item.title: EU Chemical Industry Faces Significant Decline Due to High Energy Costs and Reduced Russian Gas Imports
item.description: The European Union's chemical industry has experienced a notable downturn largely linked to the economic fallout from sanctions on Russia following the 2022 invasion of Ukraine. Prior to the conflict, Russia supplied 45% of the EU's gas at prices 30-50% below US liquefied natural gas. Sanctions drastically cut these imports, forcing reliance on pricier alternatives and contributing to a reported 9% loss in chemical production capacity, according to industry sources like CEFIC. Specific 2024 production declines included Germany (25%), the Netherlands (20%), the UK (12%), France (10%), and Spain (8%). The sector's heavy dependence on natural gas not only for energy but also as a raw material for key compounds like ammonia and methanol amplified the impact. Initial post-war price surges reached +833% for gas and +251% for electricity, with lingering elevated costs—European gas remains 345% more expensive than in the US, and industrial electricity up to four times higher—even after partial

item.title: Severe winter storms and heavy snowfall cause at least ten deaths across Japan
item.description:
Japan has been severely affected by an intense winter weather episode marked by heavy snowfall, repeated cold waves, and strong winds, resulting in at least ten fatalities across several regions. According to Japan’s Fire and Disaster Management Agency (FDMA), the deadliest impacts were recorded in Niigata Prefecture, along the Sea of Japan coast, where six people lost their lives. Two of the victims died after being struck by snow falling from rooftops in the area of Nagaoka, while four others died during snow removal operations in different parts of the prefecture.
Additional deaths were reported in the prefectures of Hokkaido, Akita, Yamagata, and Shimane, with one fatality confirmed in each location. The Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA) explained that a series of strong cold air masses caused widespread snowfall across Hokkaido, northern Tohoku, and the Hokuriku region. Although the most intense phase of snowfall has passed, snow accumulation has already exceeded the seasonal ave

item.title: Elon Musk Shares AI-Generated Video Demonstrating Grok Updates on X
item.description: Elon Musk recently shared a brief AI-generated video on X featuring digital versions of Sydney Sweeney and Regé-Jean Page. The 10-second clip, set in a futuristic style with moody lighting, depicts the AI characters discussing updates to Grok, X’s AI tool. The video showcases improved audio quality and demonstrates the new capability for longer AI-generated clips. While some users praised Grok's technical advancements and its conversational features, others raised ethical concerns regarding the use of celebrity likenesses without consent. The clip also reignited broader debates about deepfake technology, including the potential for misuse and the challenge of distinguishing AI-generated content from reality. Musk framed the video as a product update, coinciding with a recent X platform outage, signaling that development on Grok continues despite technical setbacks. Technology outlets have noted that Grok’s rapid iteration reflects Musk’s strategy to position X prominently in AI innovat

item.title: France Mandates Use of Domestic Visio Platform for Government Videoconferencing, Phasing Out US Tools like Zoom and Teams
item.description: The French government has decided to prohibit public officials from using American videoconferencing platforms such as Zoom, Microsoft Teams, and Google Meet. This policy shift is driven by a broader push toward digital sovereignty and reducing dependence on U.S.-based technology services amid growing concerns in Europe over data security and reliance on foreign providers. A spokesperson from the Interministerial Digital Authority (Dinum) confirmed to POLITICO that a formal notice is being prepared and will be published in the coming days. The notice will require state officials to switch to Visio, a home-grown videoconferencing solution developed by Dinum and hosted on infrastructure from the French company Outscale. This follows an announcement by Minister for State Reform David Amiel, who stated that France aims to fully adopt the domestic platform across government by 2027. Visio is already in use by around 40,000 staff members, including personnel from most ministries and entities

item.title: New England Dairy Farmer Raises Concerns Over Falling Milk Prices and Policy Impacts
item.description: A dairy farmer from New England has shared a heartfelt post on social media highlighting the severe financial challenges facing small dairy farms. Milk prices have fallen to around $14 per hundredweight, a level considered unsustainable for family-run operations. The farmer questions whether government policies, tariffs, bureaucratic processes, or large dairy cooperatives are partly to blame for the financial strain. They also express disappointment in political leaders, including former President Trump, whom they previously supported, for not addressing the hardships faced by dairy farmers. The post contrasts personal struggles with the broader political discourse, noting that some shared political content from pro-Trump pages clashes with the realities of farming life. Agricultural economists emphasize that milk prices are influenced by multiple factors, including production levels, feed costs, export demand, and cooperative pricing structures. Over the past decade, many small farms

item.title: Germany and France propose a core EU group to strengthen competitiveness and resilience
item.description: Germany is advocating for a 'two-speed' European Union to overcome decision-making delays within the 27-member bloc and enhance economic performance. German Finance Minister Lars Klingbeil proposed forming a core group of six leading EU economies—including France, Poland, Spain, Italy, and the Netherlands—to coordinate key policies aimed at strengthening Europe's sovereignty, resilience, and competitiveness. The initiative comes as EU nations seek to reduce reliance on imported critical raw materials, especially from China, and address potential risks from global trade fragmentation. The German and French finance ministers emphasize advancing the capital markets union, reinforcing the euro as a stable international currency, improving defense cooperation, and securing strategic resources like rare earth minerals. Klingbeil highlighted the importance of supporting European businesses, start-ups, and scale-ups by creating better financing conditions and reducing regulatory obstacles. Add

item.title: South Carolina Measles Outbreak Reaches 789 Cases, Becoming Largest in US in Nearly 30 Years
item.description: The South Carolina Department of Public Health (DPH) reported that the state's ongoing measles outbreak has increased to 789 confirmed cases, marking an addition of 89 cases over the past four days. This figure exceeds the 760-762 cases from the 2025 West Texas outbreak, which originated in an under-vaccinated Mennonite community and resulted in two child deaths, making the current South Carolina outbreak the largest in the United States in nearly three decades. The epicenter remains Spartanburg County, where the virus initially spread in October 2025 through elementary and middle schools, many private Christian academies with largely unvaccinated student populations. Holiday gatherings and travel further accelerated community transmission. Most cases (695) involve unvaccinated individuals, with 14 partially vaccinated, 20 fully vaccinated, and 60 of unknown status. The majority affect children: 493 cases in ages 5-17 and 203 in those under 5, with only 65 in adults over 18. At least 1

item.title: Palantir Employees Question Company Contracts with ICE After Fatal Shooting of Minneapolis Nurse by Federal Agents
item.description: Following the fatal shooting of Alex Pretti, a 37-year-old intensive care nurse in Minneapolis by federal agents on January 24, 2026, Palantir employees expressed significant internal discontent regarding the company's ongoing contracts with U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) and the Department of Homeland Security (DHS). In company-wide Slack channels, workers voiced ethical concerns, with one stating they viewed ICE as 'the bad guys' and felt ashamed of the association. They questioned the extent of Palantir's involvement in immigration enforcement, including whether the company could influence ICE practices or if its tools might contribute to improper targeting, such as detaining asylum seekers without criminal records. In response, Palantir's privacy and civil liberties team updated an internal wiki to outline its work, including a $30 million contract for the ImmigrationOS platform launched in April 2025. This platform supports enforcement prioritization, targeting, se

item.title: Tribute to El Loko Dope: Hip-Hop Activist from San Bernardo Murdered in Brutal Attack
item.description: Emilio Santiago Muíño shares a heartfelt personal remembrance of El Loko Dope, a Chilean hip-hop activist he met in 2007 in San Bernardo's URRAP collective during his time in Chile's activist Hip Hop network. Dope, once trapped in a severe addiction to pasta base—a drug devastating Santiago's peripheral neighborhoods—transformed his life through political hip-hop workshops, education popular, and community organizing. He became an exemplary figure of resilience, solidarity, and commitment to mutual aid, inspiring the author deeply and symbolizing hope against neoliberal destruction. Dope conducted powerful workshops, shared his story publicly to help youth escape addiction, and collaborated in music that linked personal struggle to collective resistance. Though contact faded over time due to distance, Dope remained a talisman of possibility for the author. In 2022, news arrived that Dope had relapsed amid depression, ending up homeless in a makeshift shelter while still reciprocating c

item.title: Review: Staying at London Hilton on Park Lane with Suite Upgrade and Lounge Access Using Hilton Free Night Certificates
item.description: The review details a stay at the London Hilton on Park Lane over New Year's Eve using four Hilton free night certificates. The author and family, including their dog, chose this pet-friendly hotel with an executive lounge due to limited availability elsewhere. One room was upgraded to a spacious Deluxe Park Lane Suite featuring a large living room, dining area, balcony with views, king bedroom, walk-in closet, and a bathroom with shower and tub. The only minor issue was an opaque window between bedroom and bathroom causing light disturbance. The executive lounge, accessible via the wife's Diamond status for both rooms, offered a solid breakfast and an impressive evening canapes and drinks spread, extended until 10pm on New Year's Eve with free-flowing sparkling wine. The location on Park Lane is excellent, opposite Hyde Park and near Buckingham Palace, with good tube access. Cash rates were around $976 per night, making the certificates a great value despite points costing 85,000-90,00

item.title: Germany Halts Further Delivery of Patriot Air Defense Systems to Ukraine
item.description: Germany has announced that it can no longer supply additional Patriot air defense systems to Ukraine, according to Defense Minister Boris Pistorius. Since the war began in 2022, Germany has been a major arms supplier to Ukraine, second only to the United States, spending nearly €20 billion on military aid up to October last year. The Defense Minister explained that German military production has reached its limits and that over a third of Germany's Patriot systems have already been delivered to Ukraine. Berlin must now focus on replacing the systems it has supplied and modernizing training and maintenance for its own forces. Data from the German Ministry of Economy shows a sharp drop in arms exports to Ukraine, from €8.15 billion the previous year to just €1.14 billion last year. Despite this, Germany plans to continue supporting Ukraine with an allocated €11.5 billion this year, targeting artillery, drones, armored vehicles, and potentially two more Patriot systems, though it is uncle

item.title: Zimbabwe Accelerates Diplomatic Efforts to Join BRICS Bloc
item.description: Zimbabwe is actively pursuing full membership in the BRICS group, viewing it as a key strategy to accelerate economic development and overcome international isolation. Foreign Affairs Minister Amon Murwira stated in a recent interview that the government is making sustained diplomatic efforts to expedite integration into the bloc, under the direct oversight of President Emmerson Mnangagwa. Harare has initiated formal contacts with all BRICS member states, sending official correspondence and engaging in bilateral discussions with both African and international counterparts. The country is open to participating in BRICS activities according to current provisions while awaiting full admission. This proactive approach reflects a preference for swift collaboration rather than passively waiting for a formal invitation. Beyond institutional membership, Zimbabwe sees BRICS affiliation as a vital means to enhance global economic integration, expand trade alliances, gain access to emerging marke

item.title: Ronald Reagan speaks out on Socialized Medicine - Audio
item.description: The video features an audio recording of Ronald Reagan delivering a speech criticizing socialized medicine. He argues against government control of healthcare, emphasizing individual liberty and the potential for reduced quality and efficiency.

item.title: Preferred Hotels Offers Double Points for Stays of Two Nights or More in March and April
item.description: Preferred Hotels & Resorts has launched a promotion allowing members of its I Prefer loyalty program to earn double base points for stays of two or more nights at participating properties during March and April 2026. To participate, members must register for the promotion and book stays between January 22 and April 30, 2026. The bonus applies to base points only, meaning it does not increase any status-related bonus points, and excludes certain properties like andBeyond and The Brando, which earn half the base points per dollar spent. Members must stay at least two nights for the offer to apply, and bonus points earned under this promotion will not count towards tier upgrades. While this promotion is unlikely to influence travelers to switch hotels solely to earn points, it is beneficial for those already planning qualifying stays during the promotional period. Registration is open now, but only stays during March and April 2026 will qualify. The offer is straightforward and designed t

item.title: Vaonis Hyperia: A High-End Automated Telescope Designed for Museum-Level Astronomy
item.description:
The article explores the Vaonis Hyperia, a $99,000 smart telescope originally developed as a digital observatory for a major Paris science museum and now offered to institutions and private buyers seeking professional-grade astronomical equipment. Unlike conventional backyard telescopes, Hyperia is positioned as a bridge between consumer technology and institutional astronomy, combining large-scale physical presence with advanced digital automation.
Standing roughly six feet tall when deployed, the telescope features precision optics developed in collaboration with Canon, including a wide aperture, advanced lens coatings, and a large full-frame sensor. These components allow Hyperia to capture deep-sky objects with exceptional clarity, detail, and color depth, revealing stars, nebulae, and cosmic dust in a way that goes far beyond what the naked eye or entry-level telescopes can provide.
A defining feature of Hyperia is its automated operation. Controlled through an intuitive app, th

item.title: Hilton Honors Offers Up to 100% Bonus on Point Purchases Through March 14, 2026
item.description: Hilton Honors has launched a limited-time promotion allowing members to purchase points with up to a 100% bonus, effectively reducing the cost to 0.5 cents per point. The promotion runs from January 28, 2026, to March 14, 2026, and requires a minimum purchase of 5,000 points. Members can buy up to 240,000 points per calendar year during this campaign. Points purchased under this offer do not count towards elite status qualification and are non-refundable. The points are credited within 48 hours of purchase, and Canadian residents are subject to GST/HST and Quebec residents to QST. Hilton points can be strategically used for benefits such as the fifth-night-free perk, which allows members to book five nights for the price of four, and pooling points with up to ten members to maximize the effective purchase limit. While low-category properties can be booked for as little as 5,000 points per night, high-end hotels may require up to 150,000 points per night, making the purchase advantageou

item.title: Newegg Offers $500 Southwest Gift Cards at $450 with Promo Code SSF2494 Until January 28, 2026
item.description: Newegg is currently running a limited-time promotion on Southwest Airlines gift cards. Customers can purchase $500 Southwest gift cards for $450 using the promo code SSF2494. This offer is valid until January 28, 2026, with a limit of five gift cards per customer. Additionally, certain credit card users may be able to combine this promotion with extra rewards. For example, some American Express cards offer 4x Membership Rewards points for electronics store purchases, which could include Newegg gift card purchases if the cardholder has set electronics as a top spending category. Targeted offers may also exist for Amex or Citi cardholders, providing small cashback incentives. The deal is an opportunity for frequent Southwest travelers or those looking to maximize credit card rewards. Readers interested in miles, points, and travel rewards can subscribe to Frequent Miler's email updates or listen to their podcast for further guidance. Overall, this promotion provides a discounted way to p

item.title: Report: Federal Agents Previously Broke Protester Alex Pretti's Rib and May Have Known His Identity Before Fatal Shooting
item.description: A report from The New Republic, citing CNN sources, reveals that Alex Pretti, a 37-year-old VA ICU nurse and Minneapolis protester, had his rib broken by ICE agents about a week before he was fatally shot by Border Patrol agents on January 24, 2026. The earlier incident occurred when Pretti stopped his car to observe and protest ICE agents chasing a family; he began whistling and yelling, leading five agents to tackle him, with one leaning on his back and causing the injury. Medication records reviewed by CNN were consistent with treatment for a broken rib. Sources indicated federal agents were aware of Pretti's name, potentially from a DHS surveillance database collecting information on Minneapolis protesters, amid a broader immigration enforcement surge. This raises questions about recognition during the fatal encounter. Pretti's death was the second killing of a U.S. citizen by federal immigration agents in Minneapolis that month, following Renée Nicole Good's shooting. The article

item.title: Kristi Noem Criticized by Wyoming Firearms Experts for Muzzle Sweep During ICE Photo Op
item.description: Department of Homeland Security Secretary and former South Dakota Governor Kristi Noem faced criticism after a publicity event in Arizona where she posed with Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents while holding an M4 carbine rifle. Photos and video from the event showed the muzzle of her rifle tilting toward the head and face of an agent standing to her left, an action known as 'muzzle sweep.' This violates a fundamental firearms safety rule: always keep the muzzle pointed in a safe direction and never point a gun at anything you do not intend to destroy. Wyoming firearms experts, including retired peace officer and trainer Frank Groth and NRA-certified instructor Vince Vanata, emphasized the importance of muzzle awareness and treating every firearm as if it is loaded. They noted that even if the weapon was likely unloaded for the photo op, the breach in protocol was concerning, as an accidental discharge could cause injury from muzzle blast or other hazards. While Noem kept

item.title: DHS Preliminary Report: Two Federal Agents Discharged Firearms During Fatal Shooting of Alex Pretti in Minneapolis, No Mention of Pretti Reaching for Weapon
item.description: A preliminary Department of Homeland Security (DHS) report, based on a review of body-worn camera footage and Customs and Border Protection (CBP) documentation, details the fatal shooting of 37-year-old U.S. citizen Alex Jeffrey Pretti in Minneapolis on January 24, 2026. The incident occurred amid federal immigration enforcement operations in the area. According to the report, CBP personnel ordered two female civilians to move out of a roadway during enforcement actions; when they refused, an officer pushed them, prompting one woman to run to Pretti for help. Agents then attempted to move Pretti and the woman, deploying oleoresin capsicum (OC) spray when they did not comply. Efforts to take Pretti into custody led to resistance and a physical struggle. During the altercation, a Border Patrol Agent (BPA) shouted 'He's got a gun!' multiple times. Approximately five seconds later, one BPA fired his CBP-issued Glock 19, and a CBP Officer (CBPO) fired his Glock 47 at Pretti. The report does

item.title: Slovak PM Fico expresses private concerns about Trump after Mar-a-Lago meeting
item.description: During an EU summit in Brussels on January 22, Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico privately expressed concern to fellow European leaders about U.S. President Donald Trump's state of mind following their meeting at Mar-a-Lago on January 17. Fico, usually a strong supporter of Trump, reportedly described the president as 'dangerous' and 'out of his mind' according to multiple European diplomats. The details of the conversation that triggered Fico's reaction were not disclosed. However, publicly, Fico praised the meeting on Facebook, highlighting discussions on Ukraine, U.S.-Slovakia relations, and the EU's challenges, and did not mention Greenland or other controversial topics raised by Trump earlier in January. Fico later denied POLITICO's report, calling it false, and reaffirmed his support for many of Trump's strategies. The White House also dismissed the report, describing the meeting as positive and normal. Despite these conflicting accounts, European leaders remain concerned about T

item.title: Bilt Provides Inaccurate Mastercard Benefits Information for New 2.0 Cards
item.description: Bilt's recent rollout of its 2.0 credit cards, including the Blue, Obsidian, and Palladium variants, has encountered additional issues beyond previously reported rollout challenges. When launching the new cards, Bilt shared a screenshot detailing the Mastercard World Elite benefits for the Blue and Obsidian cards, and World Legend benefits for the Palladium card. For the no-annual-fee Blue card, the provided information listed benefits such as no foreign transaction fees, cellular wireless telephone protection, purchase assurance, MasterRental coverage, trip cancellation and interruption protection, and trip delay reimbursement. However, upon reviewing the official guide to benefits for the Blue card, trip cancellation and interruption protection as well as trip delay reimbursement are not included. These specific travel-related protections are absent from the Blue card's documentation, though Bilt does not appear to have advertised them directly on their website. The article advises u

item.title: Lavish Mar-a-Lago Event Occurs Hours After Fatal Shooting of Alex Pretti by Federal Agents
item.description: On January 24, 2026, Alex Pretti, a 37-year-old intensive care nurse and U.S. citizen, was fatally shot by U.S. Customs and Border Protection agents in Minneapolis, Minnesota. The incident occurred amid protests related to federal immigration enforcement operations in the city. Videos and witness accounts indicate Pretti was holding a phone while recording or observing the scene, not brandishing his licensed firearm, when agents approached, subdued him, and fired multiple shots. Federal officials initially described it as defensive action against a perceived threat, but investigations revealed protocol issues, leading to agents being placed on leave and an ongoing review. Stephen Miller acknowledged potential deviations from procedure, and President Trump promised an honest investigation. Pretti's family described him as kind and generous, devastated by the loss. The same night or shortly after, a lavish private party took place at Mar-a-Lago, featuring showgirls, dancers in bubble-fil

item.title: Wyndham Rewards Offers Up to 80% Bonus on Point Purchases Through February 18, 2026
item.description: Wyndham Rewards has launched a promotional offer allowing members to purchase points with a significant bonus. From January 27, 2026, at 12:00:01 am ET until February 18, 2026, at 11:59:59 pm ET, eligible members can buy at least 3,000 Wyndham Rewards points in a single transaction through points.com and receive an up to 80% bonus on those points. This bonus is specifically available to Wyndham Rewards Earner Card cardmembers, reducing the effective cost to as low as 0.72 cents per point. Non-cardholders are likely eligible for a 70% bonus, resulting in approximately 0.76 cents per point, though exact pricing requires login to verify. The promotion applies only to online purchases, and points are posted to the account within 72 hours. Key restrictions include an annual purchase cap of 100,000 points (before bonus), no refunds, and transactions not counting toward elite status levels. Additional taxes like GST/HST apply for Canadian residents, with QST for those in Quebec. This deal can

item.title: EU proposes stricter foreign investment rules and joint ventures to boost industrial production
item.description: The European Commission is considering a major shift in its industrial strategy, inspired by China’s historical approach to economic growth. Under the proposed Industrial Accelerator Act (IAA), foreign companies investing in key strategic sectors of the EU would be required to form partnerships with European firms. These joint ventures would include mandatory sharing of know-how, a limit of 49% on foreign ownership, and a requirement to source half of manufacturing within the EU. The policy aims to raise industrial production from 14.3% of EU gross added value in 2020 to at least 20% by 2030. Critics argue that the move contradicts Europe’s long-standing commitment to open markets and could face legal and political challenges, including resistance from member states such as Sweden. While inspired by China’s success in leveraging joint ventures to acquire technology and create domestic supply chains, experts warn that Europe may struggle to replicate China’s strategy due to differences

item.title: Trump defends limits on carrying guns after fatal federal shooting of Alex Pretti
item.description:
The article reports on comments by U.S. President Donald Trump following the fatal shooting of 37-year-old Alex Pretti by federal agents. Before departing the White House for a trip to Iowa on Tuesday, Trump spoke briefly with reporters about the incident and was asked to respond to public concern. He described the situation as very sad, stressing that he felt compassion for Pretti’s family and referring broadly to his affection for “all of our people.”
When addressing the circumstances around the shooting, Trump emphasized that individuals “can’t have guns” and “can’t walk in with guns,” suggesting that carrying firearms into certain situations is unacceptable. His remarks prompted a reporter to challenge him by invoking the Second Amendment, which protects the right to keep and bear arms in the United States. Rather than directly engaging with the constitutional question, Trump repeated his point that people cannot walk in with guns and that such actions are not permitted.
The exc

item.title: US citizen five-year-old girl deported to Honduras with undocumented mother amid Trump administration immigration enforcement
item.description: A five-year-old U.S. citizen, Génesis Ester Gutiérrez Castellanos, was deported on January 11, 2026, to Honduras along with her mother, Karen Guadalupe Gutiérrez Castellanos, despite never having lived in the country. The mother, who entered the U.S. in 2018 fleeing poverty, received a deportation order in 2019 but stayed after giving birth to Génesis in 2020. Karen had applied for a U visa due to domestic violence from the child's father, but her application remained pending amid significant backlogs. The deportation followed a domestic disturbance call to Austin police, who discovered the outstanding ICE warrant and notified the agency. ICE detained the pair, holding them in a San Antonio hotel for nearly a week without immediate access to a lawyer, phone calls, or a judicial hearing, raising concerns about procedural violations and limited legal representation. Activists from Grassroots Leadership highlighted the case as part of broader issues in mass deportations under the Trump ad

item.title: Review of Autopilot Service for Automatic Flight Rebooking on Price Drops
item.description: Autopilot is a tool designed to monitor paid flight reservations and automatically rebook them when fares drop by $20 or more, securing airline credits for the difference while keeping the same flight, cabin, and seat. Users can add bookings manually, forward confirmation emails, or allow Gmail scanning (though the author prefers avoiding scanning). The service ensures rebookings stay within the same fare product, such as not switching from Economy to Basic Economy, though the specific fare class may change. It charges 25% of the savings under the 'Pay Per Win' plan with no upfront fee, or offers a Pro tier for $9.99/month that lowers the fee to 15% and adds monitoring for award reservations (notifying users of price drops for manual rebooking). Currently, it supports American, Delta, and United airlines, with plans to add JetBlue, Alaska, and eventually Southwest. The author, a frequent 'gardener' of reservations who obsessively checks for better prices, tested the service and appreci

item.title: Southwest Business offers targeted bonus points and temporary Companion Pass for select members
item.description: Southwest Airlines is running a targeted promotion for select Rapid Rewards members, offering bonus points and a limited-time Companion Pass. Members eligible for this promotion must register before booking and flying qualifying flights between January 15 and April 15, 2026, using eligible booking channels such as SWABIZ, Global Distribution System (GDS), or direct connect/API partners. The promotion works in two tiers: booking and flying two round-trip flights (or four one-way flights) earns 5,000 bonus Rapid Rewards points, while booking and flying four round-trip flights (or eight one-way flights) earns an additional 2,500 points for a total of 7,500 points and grants a promotional Companion Pass. The Companion Pass can be used between May 1 and July 31, 2026, allowing a designated companion to fly free of airline charges on flights purchased by the member, excluding taxes and fees. Only flights paid with cash, Southwest LUV Vouchers, gift cards, flight credits, or Cash + Points qua

item.title: ICE Fails to Report Eight Immigrant Deaths in Custody Despite Congressional Mandate
item.description: An investigation by Zeteo revealed that U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) has failed to comply with federal law requiring disclosure of deaths occurring in its custody. Since February of the previous year, at least eight immigrants have died while detained by ICE, but the agency has not provided the necessary reports within the congressionally mandated 90-day period. This failure includes seven deaths since October across six states, as well as one case in Puerto Rico earlier in the year involving an alleged drug smuggler. The lapse in transparency violates statutes included in ICE’s funding legislation and raises questions about accountability in the nation’s detention system. The report comes amid an increase in the number of detainees under Donald Trump’s administration, with ICE operating its largest detention capacity in history. At the same time, concerns about human rights violations and medical neglect in detention centers are intensifying. The Senate is reviewing

item.title: Protesters in Minneapolis demand accountability for the shooting of man by federal agents | DW News
item.description: The video reports on protests in Minneapolis following the shooting of a man by federal agents. Demonstrators are demanding accountability and transparency regarding the incident. The video includes interviews with protesters and some details surrounding the event. It highlights the tense relationship between communities and federal law enforcement.

item.title: Philip Glass Withdraws Symphony No. 15 'Lincoln' Premiere from Kennedy Center Citing Value Conflict Under Current Leadership
item.description: Renowned American composer Philip Glass, aged 88 and widely regarded as one of the most influential figures in contemporary classical music, has withdrawn his latest work, Symphony No. 15 titled 'Lincoln', from its scheduled world premiere at the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts in Washington, D.C. The premiere was set for June with the National Symphony Orchestra. Glass announced his decision on January 27, stating on social media that after careful consideration, he felt compelled to pull the piece because the symphony portrays Abraham Lincoln and embodies values that are now in direct conflict with those of the Kennedy Center under its current leadership. This leadership change stems from President Donald Trump's takeover of the institution, including his appointment as chairman, board restructuring with allies, and the renaming of the venue to incorporate his name as the Trump-Kennedy Center in late 2025. Glass emphasized that the work's message, centered on Lincoln's

item.title: The Legal and Human Impact of Economic Sanctions and Blockades
item.description: The article examines economic sanctions and blockades as tools of modern geopolitical conflict, focusing on the long-standing U.S. embargo against Cuba. It traces the legal and historical background, citing the 1974 UN General Assembly Resolution 3314, which classifies the blockade of a state's ports in peacetime as an act of aggression. The 1986 International Court of Justice ruling against the U.S. in the Nicaragua case confirmed that interfering with peaceful maritime trade is illegal. The U.S. has circumvented international law through domestic legislation, such as the Trading with the Enemy Act of 1917 and its later extensions, to impose unilateral sanctions without formal war declarations. The embargo against Cuba, in place since 1962, has caused severe humanitarian consequences, including widespread malnutrition and limited access to medical care. The article also highlights how sanctions have evolved into indirect forms affecting third-party countries, companies, and individual

item.title: Individual in Critical Condition Following Border Patrol Shooting in Southern Arizona
item.description: A person was critically injured in a shooting incident involving U.S. Border Patrol agents in southern Pima County, Arizona, early Tuesday morning. The individual, whose identity has not been released, was shot near milepost 15 of West Arivaca Road around 7:30 a.m. Emergency personnel from the Santa Rita Fire District and American Medical Response provided immediate care and transported the person via medical helicopter to a regional trauma center. Law enforcement authorities, led by the Pima County Sheriff's Department (PCSD) with assistance from the FBI, are actively investigating the circumstances of the shooting. No law enforcement officers were reported injured in the incident, and the Department of Homeland Security had not yet provided a comment. This event follows recent controversial shootings by federal immigration officers, including the fatal shootings of Alex Pretti in Minneapolis and Renee Good, which have sparked protests and criticism of the Department of Homeland Secur

item.title: Guide to Earning Airline Points on Airbnb Bookings Through Partnerships
item.description: Airbnb partners with several airline loyalty programs, allowing users to earn points or miles on their stays by booking through specific links after logging into their accounts. The options include British Airways Executive Club, where members earn 2 Avios per £1, €1, or $1 spent on stays and Experiences. Delta SkyMiles members earn 1 SkyMile per $1 spent by accessing Airbnb via the dedicated Delta link. Qantas Frequent Flyer offers 1 point per AUD spent, plus 500 bonus points on the first booking through their portal. ANA Mileage Club provides 2 miles per JPY 200 for first-time users (possibly extended beyond the stated December 31, 2025 expiration) and 1 mile per JPY 200 for existing members. To maximize value, users can combine these earnings with discounted Airbnb gift cards, such as those available at 5% off from AARP (up to $500 denominations, limited to five per month) or via Zift multi-brand cards on sale. The author notes successfully using Avios or SkyMiles on US road trip st

item.title: China's Belt and Road Initiative Achieves Record Engagement in Africa in 2025, Focusing on Energy and Mining
item.description: The article discusses China's renewed and intensified engagement in Africa through the Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) in 2025. After a slowdown in the mid-2010s due to debt concerns and strategic reevaluation, China accelerated its activities, signing around 350 agreements worth over $210 billion—the highest annual total since the BRI began. Africa has become a primary focus, with a significant surge in investments and construction contracts. The strategy has shifted to productive sectors rather than broad infrastructure lending. Energy projects, including renewables like solar, wind, and hydro, as well as oil and gas, play a central role in addressing Africa's energy demands and strengthening Chinese market presence. Mining has also seen record commitments for extracting and processing strategic minerals vital for global tech and energy sectors. This reorientation highlights Africa's importance for China's access to resources and industrial partnerships, prioritizing production-linked

item.title: Get 250 I Prefer Points by Voting for Your Favorite Preferred Hotels Property
item.description: Preferred Hotels & Resorts is offering members a simple way to earn 250 I Prefer points by voting for their favorite property. This promotion is available to active I Prefer members and runs until January 31, 2026. Each member can earn the bonus points only once, and the points will be credited to valid accounts within 30 days. While 250 points are valued at approximately $1.25, the main benefit of participating is that it extends the expiration date of any existing I Prefer points in your account. To participate, members simply need to follow the direct link provided by Preferred Hotels, vote for their favorite property, and ensure their account email is valid. This small, low-effort promotion may be particularly useful for members who already have I Prefer points nearing expiration and want to preserve their value. For additional tips on earning miles and points, Frequent Miler offers email updates and a podcast covering the latest loyalty program news and strategies.

item.title: Hailey Bieber's Sister Alaia Baldwin Aronow Charged with Misdemeanors in 2024 Georgia Nightclub Incident
item.description: Alaia Baldwin Aronow, the 33-year-old older sister of Hailey Bieber and daughter of actor Stephen Baldwin, is facing potential jail time following misdemeanor charges filed by Georgia prosecutors in January 2026. The charges—simple battery, simple assault, battery, and criminal trespass—stem from an incident on February 24, 2024, at Club Elan in Georgia, where she was arrested after an altercation with staff. According to police reports obtained by multiple outlets, Aronow allegedly forced her way into a locked employee bathroom to change a tampon. Bartender Haleigh Cauley permitted brief access, but upon returning, Aronow reportedly removed and threw the used tampon at her. When security intervened to escort her out, she allegedly resisted, pulling hair from one bouncer's scalp and striking another in the genitals, as captured on surveillance video. Aronow initially denied forcing entry and throwing the tampon but later admitted to the latter, while claiming self-defense during the ph

item.title: Colonial Legacies, Historical Amnesia, and Europe’s Moral Contradictions
item.description:
In this long-form opinion essay, Rafael Poch de Feliu argues that contemporary European complicity with Israeli policies toward Palestinians cannot be understood without confronting Europe’s own colonial past, particularly that of the British Empire. The author contends that Western governments, institutions, and media reproduce old imperial logics under new moral vocabularies, today framed around human rights, gender equality, and humanitarian discourse.
Poch emphasizes the ideological role of the entertainment industry, especially Hollywood and British cinema, in romanticizing colonial violence and transforming historical atrocities into heroic narratives. Films depicting imperial expansion in Asia, Africa, and the Middle East are presented as cultural tools that normalize domination and obscure mass suffering, such as famines, forced labor, and racial hierarchies.
The essay details the British Empire’s use of repression, mass incarceration, and deportation, describing a global sys

item.title: Spencer Pratt Admits in Memoir to Selling Private Teen Photos of Mary-Kate Olsen for $50,000
item.description: In his newly released memoir 'The Guy You Loved to Hate: Confessions from a Reality TV Villain,' Spencer Pratt reveals a controversial incident from his teenage years in Santa Monica, California. While attending school with celebrity peers, including Mary-Kate Olsen and her then-boyfriend Max Winkler (son of actor Henry Winkler), Pratt aspired to direct his own film but lacked funding. After Olsen and Winkler broke up, Pratt noticed a collection of personal photos of the couple on Winkler's bedroom wall, which he described as documenting 'young love' in various settings like European hotels and Hollywood parties. Claiming he was helping his friend with the 'healing process,' Pratt took the photos without explicit objection from Winkler. He then sold them to a photo agency for $50,000, using the money toward his film project. The images quickly appeared in tabloids, including an InTouch cover story headlined 'TEENS GONE WILD!,' portraying Olsen's supposed wild phase with alcohol and par

item.title: Frequent Miler Podcast Analyzes Bilt Cash Rewards Currency and Its Limitations
item.description: In this episode of the Coffee Break podcast from Frequent Miler, published on January 27, 2026, the hosts examine the introduction of Bilt Cash as part of the Bilt 2.0 program update. Bilt 2.0 launched new credit cards, modified ways to earn rewards on housing payments like rent and mortgages, and added this new rewards currency called Bilt Cash. The discussion highlights how Bilt Cash is earned primarily through everyday spending on the new Bilt cards, often at rates like 4% back, but it comes with complexities. Key points include its expiration, notably on December 31 each year when unused Bilt Cash is lost (referred to as 'Bilt Cash Gets Trashed Day'), though some carryover may be allowed up to a limit like $100. Usage is restricted and functions more like coupons or discounts within the Bilt ecosystem rather than flexible cash equivalents, such as unlocking additional points on housing payments (e.g., using Bilt Cash to convert to points at ratios like $30 for 1,000 points on rent/

item.title: Ice agent tries to enter Ecuadorian consulate in Minneapolis
item.description: The video shows an ICE (Immigration and Customs Enforcement) agent attempting to enter the Ecuadorian consulate in Minneapolis. Consulate staff prevent the agent from entering, and a brief standoff occurs. The reason for the agent's attempted entry is unclear from the video's footage.

item.title: Tensions Rise as US Threatens Tariffs Amid Canada-China Trade Agreement
item.description: The news reports on escalating tensions between the United States, Canada, and China regarding trade relations. On Saturday, US President Donald Trump threatened Canada with 100% tariffs on Canadian imports if Canada signs a trade agreement with China. Trump criticized Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney, suggesting that Canada should not serve as a gateway for Chinese goods entering the US. Trump warned that China would 'devour Canada,' claiming it could destroy its economy and way of life. The announcement follows Canada’s recent agreements with China on reciprocal tariffs and the import of 49,000 Chinese electric vehicles under preferential tariffs of 6.1%. These agreements mark a significant step in strengthening China-Canada relations, which have been tense since 2018 due to the Huawei executive's arrest in Canada and subsequent detention of Canadian citizens in China. Despite Trump's threats, much of Canada-US trade remains tariff-free under NAFTA. The article highlights the comp

item.title: UAE Refuses Permission for U.S. Military Actions Against Iran from Its Territory
item.description: The United Arab Emirates (UAE) has firmly stated that it will not permit the United States to launch any military attacks against Iran from its territory. This announcement comes in response to former President Donald Trump's recent declaration of a U.S. naval deployment to the Middle East, which is intended to pressure Iran. The UAE’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs emphasized that protecting its land, airspace, and maritime borders is a top priority and that any use of its territory for offensive operations against another sovereign nation would be unacceptable. The UAE's refusal directly affects U.S. strategic and logistical planning, limiting potential positions for naval operations and supply routes. The statement highlights the vigilance of Gulf countries regarding regional diplomacy and underscores the UAE’s neutral stance in the potential U.S.-Iran conflict. While the U.S. fleet, including warships and an aircraft carrier, moves toward the region, it must now operate within areas w

item.title: Minneapolis Companies Struggle Amid ICE Raids and Migrant Worker Shortages
item.description: In Minneapolis, recent ICE raids targeting migrant workers have created tension and instability among local businesses. Following the killing of Alex Pretti, companies and religious leaders have pushed for calm, highlighting how enforcement actions have disrupted labor availability. Two U.S. citizen employees of Target were briefly detained, sparking outrage and strikes among workers. Churches urged companies to take a stand, leading to discussions about restricting ICE police presence in commercial areas. Earlier in January, Hilton Hotels faced pressure after refusing ICE reservations, and the Department of Homeland Security accused the chain of siding with criminals. On a recent protest day, most stores closed, pedestrian traffic declined, and restaurants and shops remained dark due to labor shortages, as migrant workers stayed home out of fear. Officials and business leaders, including Matt Varilek of the Minnesota Employment and Economic Development Department and the Minnesota Cha

item.title: Mental Health and Job Stress Crisis Among Indian Tech Workers Amid AI Disruption
item.description: The Indian tech industry, valued at around $280 billion and employing over 5 million people, is facing a growing crisis of mental health, burnout, and job insecurity. Nikhil Somwanshi, a 24-year-old machine-learning engineer, is one among many employees struggling under extreme workloads, with long hours and intense pressure exacerbated by the rise of AI-driven layoffs. Studies show that over 80% of tech workers experience burnout, many working over 70 hours per week, leading to physical health issues such as liver disease and organ failure. The pandemic and remote work have blurred the boundaries between personal and professional life, increasing stress levels. AI automation has begun threatening entry-level and mid-level positions, while global layoffs in the tech sector have amplified fears of job loss. Reports indicate over 227 tech worker suicides in India between 2017 and 2025, reflecting a worrying trend. Families of workers like Somwanshi describe isolation, loneliness, and ove

item.title: Microsoft investigates Windows 11 January 2026 update causing boot failures on some PCs
item.description:
Microsoft has confirmed that a limited number of Windows 11 users are experiencing critical boot failures after installing the January 2026 security update released on January 13. According to an official online bulletin, affected systems may fail to start and instead display a black screen accompanied by the stop code “UNMOUNTABLE_BOOT_VOLUME,” leaving users unable to complete the startup process without manual intervention.
The issue appears to primarily affect physical machines running Windows 11 versions 24H2 and 25H2. While Microsoft states that only a small number of reports have been received, the severity of the problem has raised concern, as impacted devices require recovery through the Windows Recovery Environment and the removal of the latest security update to restore functionality. At the time of reporting, Microsoft has not identified the root cause of the boot failures, nor has it released a fix or workaround beyond manual recovery.
This latest problem adds to a growin

item.title: Border Patrol Commander Greg Bovino Demoted Following Minneapolis Shooting
item.description: Gregory Bovino, previously serving as Border Patrol's 'commander at large,' has been removed from his position and will return to his former post in El Centro, California, with retirement expected soon. His demotion follows the fatal shooting of 37-year-old Alex Pretti by agents under his command in Minneapolis. The incident has prompted the Trump administration to reconsider its aggressive immigration enforcement tactics, signaling a potential shift away from the nationwide mass-deportation campaign. President Trump indicated alignment with Minnesota Governor Tim Walz and assigned former ICE chief Tom Homan to oversee federal operations in Minnesota. Bovino had become a prominent public figure during the administration's traveling immigration crackdown, often engaging in political discourse and social media promotion, which unsettled career ICE and CBP officials. In Minneapolis, he defended the agents' actions in the Pretti shooting, falsely claiming that Pretti posed a threat to Bord

item.title: Tourist Injured in Rare Snow Leopard Encounter Near Xinjiang Ski Area
item.description:
A female skier was injured in a rare wildlife encounter after being attacked by a snow leopard while skiing in Fuyun County, near China’s northern border with Mongolia. The incident occurred on a Friday evening when the tourist reportedly noticed the elusive animal in the snow and approached to within approximately ten feet in an attempt to take a photograph. Video footage circulating online shows the woman lying face-down in the snow following the attack, and later being escorted away with visible facial injuries and significant bleeding.
According to reports, a ski instructor intervened by waving his ski poles, successfully driving the snow leopard away and preventing further harm. Authorities stated that the woman’s ski helmet played a crucial role in protecting her from potentially life-threatening injuries. She was transported to a local hospital, where she was reported to be in stable condition.
The attack took place near the Keketuohai UNESCO Global Geopark in the Xinjiang reg

item.title: China Advances Plans for Two Nuclear-Powered Probes to Explore the Heliosphere's Boundaries
item.description: China is developing an ambitious interstellar mission featuring two probes to investigate the heliosphere's structure and its interaction with the interstellar medium. Unlike previous missions such as the Voyagers, which relied on radioisotope thermoelectric generators (RTGs), these probes will employ 1-kilowatt fission nuclear reactors using uranium-molybdenum alloy fuel, sodium coolant, and thermoelectric conversion with silicon-germanium alloys. This design ensures long-term power for over 30 years and allows safe launch in a shutdown state to prevent radioactive release in accidents. Each probe has a maximum mass of 8.2 tons, enabling launch aboard Long March 5 rockets, making this the second dual Long March 5 mission after Tianwen-3.
